newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania central bank one-week rate up to 51 pct.
newsitem.headline: Romania central bank one-week rate up to 51 pct.

text.p: The National Bank of Romania (BNR) said it had raised the minimum permitted rate on its one-week refinancing funds to 51 percent from 49 percent last week.
Traders took the move as a sign of the BNR's intention to slightly tighten its monetary policy to prop up the leu currency ahead of dollar hoarding which is common in winter.
The BNR's offer at Thursday's auction stayed unchanged at 500 billion lei. Auction results will be displayed on FXRP later on Thursday or early on Friday.
At last week's refinancing auction the one-week rate rose to 58.4 percent from a previous 52.75 following a heavy oversubscription of central bank funds. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
